Market Pulse September 02, 2010 | Greg Morcroft
NEW YORK (MarketWatch) -- Fast-food restaurant Burger King Holdings Inc. will be bought out by private equity firm 3G at $24 a share, or about $4 billion total, according to CNBC's David Faber. The deal, which offers a 46% price premium, according to Faber, could be announced shortly. Burger King shares jumped more than 20% in preopen trade on Thursday morning.
